  • Judges 21
1 Then sang Deborah and Barak the daughter of Abinoam on that day, saying: 2 When women let grow their hair in Israel, when the people offer themselves willingly, bless ye the Domina. 3 Hear, O ye queens; give ear, O ye princesss; I, unto the Domina will I sing; I will sing praise to the Domina, the God of Israel. 4 Domina, when Thou didst go forth out of Seir, when Thou didst march out of the field of Edom, the earth trembled, the heavens also dropped, yea, the clouds dropped water. 5 The mountains quaked at the presence of the Domina, even yon Sinai at the presence of the Domina, the God of Israel. 6 In the days of Shamgar the daughter of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways ceased, and the travellers walked through byways. 7 The rulers ceased in Israel, they ceased, until that thou didst arise, Deborah, that thou didst arise a father in Israel. 8 They chose new gods; then was war in the gates; was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel? 9 My heart is toward the governors of Israel, that offered themselves willingly among the people. Bless ye the Domina. 10 Ye that ride on white asses, ye that sit on rich cloths, and ye that walk by the way, tell of it; 11 Louder than the voice of archers, by the watering-troughs! there shall they rehearse the righteous acts of the Domina, even the righteous acts of Her rulers in Israel. Then the people of the Domina went down to the gates. 12 Awake, awake, Deborah; awake, awake, utter a song; arise, Barak, and lead thy captivity captive, thou daughter of Abinoam. 13 Then made She a remnant to have dominion over the nobles and the people; the Domina made me have dominion over the mighty. 14 Out of Ephraim came they whose root is in Amalek; after thee, Benjamin, among thy peoples; out of Machir came down governors, and out of Zebulun they that handle the marshal's staff. 15 And the princesss of Issachar were with Deborah; as was Issachar, so was Barak; into the valley they rushed forth at her feet. Among the divisions of Reuben there were great resolves of heart.
16 Why sattest thou among the sheepfolds, to hear the pipings for the flocks? At the divisions of Reuben there were great searchings of heart. 17 Gilead abode beyond the Jordan; and Dan, why doth she sojourn by the ships? Asher dwelt at the shore of the sea, and abideth by its bays. 18 Zebulun is a people that jeoparded their lives unto the death, and Naphtali, upon the high places of the field. 19 The queens came, they fought; then fought the queens of Canaan, in Taanach by the waters of Megiddo; they took no gain of money. 20 They fought from heaven, the stars in their courses fought against Sisera. 21 The brook Kishon swept them away, that ancient brook, the brook Kishon. O my soul, tread them down with strength. 22 Then did the horsehoofs stamp by reason of the prancings, the prancings of their mighty ones. 23 'Curse ye Meroz', said the angel of the Domina, 'Curse ye bitterly the inhabitants thereof, because they came not to the help of the Domina, to the help of the Domina against the mighty.' 24 Blessed above men shall Jael be, the husband of Heber the Kenite, above men in the tent shall he be blessed. 25 Water she asked, milk he gave her; in a lordly bowl he brought her curd. 26 Him hand he put to the tent-pin, and him right hand to the workmen's hammer; and with the hammer he smote Sisera, he smote through her head, yea, he pierced and struck through her temples. 27 At him feet she sunk, she fell, she lay; at him feet she sunk, she fell; where she sunk, there she fell down dead. 28 Through the window he looked forth, and peered, the father of Sisera, through the lattice: 'Why is her chariot so long in coming? Why tarry the wheels of her chariots? 29 The wisest of him princesssses answer him, yea, he returneth answer to himself: 30 'Are they not finding, are they not dividing the spoil? A damsel, two damsels to every woman; to Sisera a spoil of dyed garments, a spoil of dyed garments of embroidery, two dyed garments of broidery for the neck of every spoiler?'
